intro: Ammobium craspedioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed flax, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Ammobium craspedioides is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
